bib_record.title: Stellar cross sections for 33S(n,alpha)30Si, 36Cl(n,p)36S, and 36Cl(n,alpha)33P and the origin of 36S

information on the differential cross section for 36Cl
6Li glass monitor located 83 cm from the
neutron target to determine neutron flux
A set of Frish-gridded ionization chambers
filled with C-F4 gas - for charged particles
Unspecified germanium detector for gamma rays
Lithium targets of different thicknesses were
used to obtain neutrons in different energy intervals
For integral neutron flux measurements with
values for different energies are taken from
1.S/C1 sample. Ion implantation in a carbon plate
30 mm diameter and 0.7 mm thick, sample diameter

aluminium oxide layer, sample diameter 28 mm, mass

aluminium oxide layer, sample diameter 28 mm, mass

6.S/Au5 sample. Deposition of K2-S-O4 solution in
aluminium oxide layer, with gold foil, sample diameter
The average cross section value 183+/9 mb (p.385
left) was derived from data presented in Subent 002
and was corrected for the deviation of experimental
neutron spectrum from pure Maxwellian. This
correction factor was determined to be 0.96+0.01 by
comparison of the average cross section for the
experimental spectrum and for the ideal case using
the differential data of Wagemans (see REL-REF).
values for different energies are taken from
